title: command prompt 62 ping, Game, 300+
body:
Last couple of days I've been getting stupid lag games, 250-300 ping, or starts normal then spikes every 30-40 seconds. When I ping the server from the command prompt it shows a steady 62 ping, even though in game I never get under 73. Reboots, reloads, ensuring all background tasks are off (windows doesn't auto update and neither does AV software) it remains at that ping, despite the ping showing 62 at all times.

What's happening with the client? It's just getting worse, and worse, and worse.

Here is the tracert
 1     1 ms     1 ms     1 ms  192-168-1-1.tpgi.com.au [192.168.1.1]
  2    48 ms    50 ms    51 ms  10-20-25-52.tpgi.com.au [10.20.25.52]
  3    69 ms    71 ms    74 ms  adl-adc-lon-crt2-be-100.tpgi.com.au [203.219.199.2]
  4    73 ms    65 ms    66 ms  nme-sot-dry-crt2-be-50.tpgi.com.au [203.219.199.142]
  5    64 ms    67 ms    69 ms  syd-apt-ros-crt2-be-10.tpgi.com.au [202.7.171.153]
  6    79 ms    78 ms    76 ms  syd-apt-ros-wgw1-be-20.tpgi.com.au [203.29.134.71]
  7    76 ms    75 ms    73 ms  be300.sglebbrdr11.aapt.net.au [203.219.107.198]
  8    69 ms    75 ms    66 ms  203-174-139-185.syd.static-ipl.aapt.com.au [203.174.139.185]

here is the ping
Reply from 203.174.139.185: bytes=32 time=61ms TTL=57
Reply from 203.174.139.185: bytes=32 time=63ms TTL=57
Reply from 203.174.139.185: bytes=32 time=61ms TTL=57
Reply from 203.174.139.185: bytes=32 time=62ms TTL=57

Ping statistics for 203.174.139.185:
    Packets: Sent = 4, Received = 4, Lost = 0 (0% loss),
Approximate round trip times in milli-seconds:
    Minimum = 61ms, Maximum = 63ms, Average = 61ms

replies.body: A line test will only result in them seeing the same thing I see when i ping the server, a 62 ping showing line is fine. The problem is somewhere in the server/client communication.

You should speak to your Internet Service provider and have them run a line test. If they give you the run around, speak to the Telecommunications Industry Ombudsman https://www.tio.com.au/

I would personally get the TIO involved every time I have to deal with my ISP. Makes them get things done fast. The TIO only gets involved once you have tried to resolved the problem with your ISP.
